Community Hub
Ampu-Tea
The surgeon-simulator inspired Tea-making game is now available on Steam! Using the latest KS-001 Robo-Arm, you must practise making various types of tea.
User reviews: Mixed (963 reviews) - 60% of the 963 user reviews for this game are positive.
Release Date: May 30, 2014

About This Game

It’s time for rehabilitation! You’re a recovering amputee, fitted with the latest modern technology. The KS-001 Robo-arm is capable of delicate tasks – if used efficiently.

What better challenge for the son of an Earl than to make tea for his father?

Good luck son.

You'll need it.
READ MORE

System Requirements

    Minimum:
    • OS: Windows XP
    • Processor: 1.6ghz CPU
    • Memory: 1024 MB RAM
    • Graphics: All DX9+
    • DirectX: Version 9.0
    • Hard Drive: 512 MB available space
    Recommended:
    • OS: Windows 7
    • Processor: 3.2 ghz CPU
    • Memory: 1024 MB RAM
    • DirectX: Version 9.0a
    • Hard Drive: 512 MB available space

22 of 27 people (81%) found this review helpful
1 person found this review funny
[J7] Dsp21
238 products in account
12 reviews
Not Recommended
2.8 hrs on record
Posted: July 31
It just feels like Surgeon Simulator's rejected brother, it fails just miserably at trying to be one of these simulation games. Where should I start? These are some of the worst controls I've ever experienced in a game. I'm not even kidding when I say I've spent about 15 minutes trying to grab a cup to even start the tea making process. Yeah, I know for sure that this is the humorous nature of the game, but it shouldn't be this difficult, and hell, it just becomes annoying and not even slightly challenging. I couldn't feel anything else but disappointment while playing this, it's just not what I was expecting. Graphically, it does look bad too, even on the highest settings. Also, all the meme references shoved in your face feel downright unfunny. Thank god I bought this on sales, and as much as I hate to compare things, you should go for Surgeon Sim if you're looking for a better game overall. Ampu-Tea is a 2/10 for me.

Short version for the laziest, like me!
+Easy achievements
+Music was short but bearable
-Horrible controls
-Ugly
-Fun for 2 minutes
-Too many funny maymays
-Not worth full price

Shrodu
113 products in account
60 reviews
Not Recommended
6.1 hrs on record
Posted: June 5
You know, I thought people were exaggerating when they said this game was bad. And I thought the trailer's exaggeration was just random b*tching...but it's really not as fun as you'd think.

Sure the idea is simple. So you'd think "This is gonna be pretty cool". When you play for the first 5 minutes, you'll realize the error of your ways.

Thumbs Down 
A Screenshot of Ampu-Tea
By: Shrodu



Pros:
Nice graphics
Nice effort in attempting to recreate Surgeon Simulator (which I've yet to play at this point, so I'm going on hearsay here.)

Cons:
Grab physics are.....really bad. Sometimes your fingers feel like they have glue on the tips...other times, it's way too difficult to grab a teabag, a cup, or sugarcube.)
Objects phase through the hand. (The cup will fall through your fingers often)
On most boots, the table and the silver platter (where you place your finished tea) won't appear, so you'll be working on an invisible table.
When you boot the game, you'll think it's broken as you see a waving curtain and hear a tea cup break. (Press F1 to continue past this screen)


I REALLY thought this was going to be a fun game. I found myself severely disappointed. This is NOT a title that is worth $5....good thing someone gifted it to me for free.



1.5/10

F*ck you, Ampu-Tea!!! 
A Screenshot of Ampu-Tea
By: Shrodu




If you want easy achievements, try getting it during a massive sale. If you don't want a bad game staining your library, avoid!!!!

1 person found this review funny
FIRE_KEEPER
623 products in account
108 reviews
Not Recommended
1.5 hrs on record
Posted: June 5
Make no mistakes, I spent over 3 hours trying to actually grab the ****ing mug and just finish the first quest in the game, it was just in offline mode mostly so not recorded I suppose.

Why would anyone upvote this game ? forget the fact that its ridiculously hard, forget the fact that its boring so and dull and so hard to control.

its simply just too buggy and broken, the physics in the game are so far off, I am shocked that people compared this to surgeon simulator which was the reason I got it actually, and a friend recommended it so lets just say I am never listening to that person ever again.

Why I DO NOT recommend this game
Its not fun, its not relaxing or anything, its simply too frustrating not for the fact that its just hard but because its simply broken.

You use the robot arm to grab the mug, and you use QWER To clinch the fingers on it, and then they suddenly go past it like you're a ghost or something.

Then you spend most of the time trying to adjust the cup/mug whatever so you can put the teabags on it.
Then you spend even more time trying to actually grab the teabags which frankly was almost too impossible.

Yeah I get it you're trying to be like surgeon simulator with the concept, but couldn't they at least make it work ?

So many bugs, that its just ridiculous for this game to exist in a fully released state, but I suppose you'd say there is no helping in a game like this type having bugs ? yeah some of the physics based games have some funny bugs, this one is just repeating itself every time you try to past the first mission which is to just put the teabag in the god damn cup/mug.

Then you will try to lower the arm to get a better angle and with one simple push you'll knock down the entire table and/or the shelf and press F5 to restart.

And at many cases if you miss-use it the hand will disconnect and you will lose, or if you're lucky enough to survive that you will eventually break all the cup/mugs trying to just hold them and putting the ingredients in them.

The music in the game is good but with this gameplay and what not, it sorta feels like Troll-ish music that is designed to just make you annoyed and frustrated, though you can press M to toggle it.

Easy mode and hard mode are basically the exact same thing, except in easy mode you don't have to put sugar and just serve it with the teabag and milk or whatever.

And the game does not have any actual content just the first mission as i'v heard, thats really horrible, hell I got 6 achievements without actually doing anything but wave the arm.

The dev also has about 3 games on steam, and they're all horribly voted down.

why people bought it

I suppose they did so because they figured it would be as fun as surgeon simulator .... its NOT.
The price is fairly cheap so it attracted even more people.
Its been bundled a LOT of times which would explain why everyone in your friendlist probably owns it, but that does not mean that you must.



TL;DR

Do what you will, but I highly recommend you not to buy this game, and buy a better title that uses physics in a funny way like surgeon simulator or octodad or whatever. Because this game is simply ... horrible.

Was this review helpful? Yes No Funny
4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful
theotherwinchester
609 products in account
35 reviews
Recommended
3.4 hrs on record
Posted: June 18
It's relatively easy to get all of the achievements, the only one being a really huge pain is launching the game 500 times, but that can be done relatively quickly as well, as long as you know what you're doing. The gameplay is okay. I went in, like a lot of people, expecting something similar to Surgeon Simulator, and it is kind of similar, but this game is far more casual. It's still rage inducing at moments, but I was never rageful enough to RAGEQUIT. I keep my cool for the most part when playing games, though, because in the end they are just games. I think it's a pretty clever idea, and it is fun for a while. It's even more fun when you have a friend play it, especially if they get frustrated with games easily. I guess I would recommend this game to achievement hounds and people that like rage games, but given that it doesn't have a ton of replay value, I would only recommend it on sale or in a bundle.
